title: Facebook Messneger says Firefox browser unsupported for Video and Audio communications
content:
Will Firefox ever be updated to use end to end encryption so that users of Facebook Messenger can do audio and video chats as they did before META's change?

If not, Mozilla could lose a lot of Firefox users of Facebook Messenger. That includes me. I have been with FF since v0.93 :-P

Messenger audio and video chats work fine on several other browsers including Brave. There is even a Messenger App on the Microsoft store.

I would really like to see someone at Mozilla answer this.

title: Firefox Desktop not saving any cookies
content:
Version, 142.0.1 (64-bit). I have both refreshed and uninstalled/reinstalled, the latter three times with full deletion of every folder and file related to Firefox that I can locate, on the computer, in both of the active profiles of the computer (i.e. my non-admin laptop user, and the laptop's Admin account). While I do change some of the Settings when I reinstall, I haven't touched the first part of the Privacy & Security settings; it's left at Standard Enhanced Tracking Protection. In those same settings, neither have I checked the box under Cookies & Site Settings that would make the browser delete cookies every time it's closed.

I don't use the Firefox password manager, so that is unchecked. Also, I uncheck the autofill options (address, etc.).

I think I've narrowed down the problem to one of two things. I use the Bitwarden browser extension. Also, after I reinstall Firefox, I import the back-up .json file of my bookmarks, which was last saved a month ago -- long before I had this issue. Would either of these actions be interfering with Firefox saving cookies?

The only other thing to add: the laptop computer had a system board failure about a month ago, and the board was replaced by the manufacturer. (The .json bookmarks backup I'm importing was made before the computer was sent for repair.)

Also I've carefully followed the steps in the support articles related to refreshing/uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox, so no point referring me to those. :-)

title: Blocco visualizzazione cedolini (PDF buste paga in gestionale Zucchetti).
content: Dal programma gestionale Zucchetti, non riesco più a vedere e scaricare i PDF delle buste paga, nemmeno con altro browser. Uso Firefox da 5 anni e ha sempre funzionato tutto. Zucchetti è abilitato in Firefox ad aprire finestre popup e il mio firewall non ha bloccato il programma. Se mi collego dal computer aziendale ci riesco benissimo. Ho provato da un altro PC a casa mia e non riesco a vederli. Appena clicco su un documento (busta paga) per vederlo, il caricamento inizia e si ferma subito! Posto un allegato dove si vede la schermata che appare, subito dopo che ho cliccato su una busta paga (in PDF), per vederla. Mi dicono di usare l'applicazione Z-CONNECT, su smartphone, ma io mi collego da sempre sul sito di Zucchetti, da cinque anni e ha sempre funzionato tutto. Grazie se potete darmi qualche suggerimento! Paolo

title: Many problems with BOOKMARKS in FF in last few days. Can anyone help??
content:
Hi, whoever may read this ...

I asked friendly & helpful volunteer @jscher2000 a couple of days ago about the Strange Case of the Disappearing Bookmarks that suddenly befell me in FF last week.

Last night, the Bookmarks came back - or came back in part, so to speak. ~ ~ There are outstanding problems. I hope these too resolve themselves or can be resolved in the near future, as it is a bit debilitating.

So, what are my current issues/problems with Bkmrks in FF?

1) Can't search my Bookmarks any more.

I enter a search term in the Bkmrks Search box (whether all Bookmarks or a defined subsection/folder I have made) - never a response but blank (though I know that term is among bookmarks somewhere) - and then, the content list of that sub-folder of my Bookmarks even goes blank when I search there. (That content list returns when I click on another folder and back to that one, but that's not much consolation.)

2) Problem adding any new Bookmarks.

Though the "Bookmarks Star" lights up when I try to add a new Bkmrk - suggesting it has been saved - the new saves are nowhere visible among "Bookmarks". Not under the folder I chose to save them to (or tried), nor anywhere else I can see under Bookmarks, such as in the general folder.

3) Can't even Export Bookmarks any more - as html or in any other format.

I go to Manage Bookmarks, etc., and click "Export as html" ,,, nothing happens. There is no trace of an exported html or other file at the location where I decided to save the file.

(To explain what may be obvious: the point of the (attempted) Exportation on this occasion is to (try to) investigate, access the saved Bookmarks, retrieve the sites, etc.)

Can anyone help - or maybe offer solace that FF might fix itself or be fixed in the near future? Like I said, it's a bit debilitating for work, research and entertainment alike.

I should perhaps add that I prefer to use a laptop (HP) where possible.

Best wishes

Peter Shaw London
creator: pcshawuk

title: esc disables full screen on Mac
content: I always use Full Screen mode on MacOS (^⌘F). However, when I press the escape key, it always leaves Full Screen mode. This is annoying when browsing: whenever there is a popup which you should be able to leave with pressing 'Esc', the browser goes out of Full Screen. Why does 'Esc' lead to leaving Full Screen, when there is a dedicated key command to do this (^⌘F)? At least there should be a option to change this behaviour.

title: Add-On for Avast antiTrack Protection will not add in Firefox, Why?
content:
Current response is as follows:-

Oops! We can’t find that page

If you’ve followed a link from another site for an extension or theme, that item is no longer available. This could be because: 

   The developer removed it. Developers commonly do this because they no longer support the extension or theme, or have replaced it.    Mozilla removed it. This can happen when issues are found during the review of the extension or theme, or the extension or theme has been abusing the terms and conditions for addons.mozilla.org. The developer has the opportunity to resolve the issues and make the add-on available again.

Try visiting the page later, as the theme or extension may become available again. Alternatively, you may be able to find what you’re looking for in one of the available extensions or themes, or by asking for help on our community forums.
